product_name: Banila CoClean It Zero Calming Cleansing Balm
summary: SummaryHighlightsVeganBanila Co's Clean it Zero Calming Cleansing Balm dissolves waterproof makeup & impurities while gently cleansing even the most delicate skin types. This balm-to-oil formulation instantly melts to cleanse build up and makeup while Cica-Relief soothes and protects sensitive skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsDermatologist TestedHypoallergenicFormulated WithoutParabensSulfatesPhthalatesPolyethyleneMineral oilAlcoholArtificial coloringResearch ResultsClinically tested to not irritate skin* (based on a clinically study of 30 female subjects 20-60)Item 2555800How To UseUse spatula provided to scoop a small amount of cleansing balm onto dry hands then gently massage onto your dry face and eyes until makeup is fully dissolved. Add a little water to emulsify the oil and rinse face with lukewarm water.Keep out of reach of children.IngredientsCetyl Ethylhexanoate, Ethylhexyl Stearate, PEG-20 Glyceryl Triisostearate, PEG-10 Isostearate, Synthetic Wax, 1,2-Hexanediol, Water, Butylene Glycol, Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, Centella Asiatica Extract, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Onsen-Sui, Dipropylene Glycol, Eucalyptus Globulus Leaf Oil, Citrus Aurantium Bergamia (Bergamot) Fruit Oil, Guaiazulene, Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Oil, Anthemis Nobilis Flower Oil, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Extract, Lactobacillus Ferment, Asiaticoside, Asiatic Acid, Madecassoside, Madecassic Acid.
how_to_use: Use spatula provided to scoop a small amount of cleansing balm onto dry hands then gently massage onto your dry face and eyes until makeup is fully dissolved. Add a little water to emulsify the oil and rinse face with lukewarm water.Keep out of reach of children.

reviews.headline: Makeup Remover
reviews.comments: Works well as a makeup remover. Does not irritate my sensitive/acne-prone skin. No obvious improvement in skin condition, but I also do not use it daily.

reviews.headline: Just as good as Clinique
reviews.comments: This is one of my favorite beauty products. I bought this because I have sensitive skin and hate when cleansing balms have a fragrance. No smell, gentle on skin, and reasonably priced. Just as good as Clinique "Take The Day Off," but less than half the price.

reviews.headline: Great cleansing balm
reviews.comments: This product removed my makeup easily. It is gentle on the skin. Great product.

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: I was introduced to this product by employee at Ulta. Takes off all my makeup so easily particularly my eye makeup without the need to use any other product. Skin feels clean and moisturized at the same time.

reviews.headline: Favorite Makeup Removing Balm
reviews.comments: I use this as my first step in a double cleanse, and it removes my makeup, doesn't strip my skin, and doesn't irritate my sensitive, breakout prone skin. I've been using this balm for a good two years now, and I highly recommend for anybody who finds the scent and oils in other balms to be irritating.

reviews.headline: not sensitive skin friendly
reviews.comments: I love the orginal formula and wanted to use this one and try it since it was one sale. I patch tested on my arm for 48 hours before I tested it on my face with no issues, then used it on my face just the cheek then my eyes for 10 days. My eyes got so itchy I couldn't open them it was not worth it. I had to return it and get the original one which was the pink jar.

reviews.headline: Check expiration date!!
reviews.comments: I've repurchased this product several times and was excited to see that it was on sale a few months ago. I purchased on September 29 and just got around to opening the product on December 14 only to find that the expiration date on the bottom of the package reads November 7, 2024. I realized that something was off because the balm is white (old formula) and with the past few containers of this exact product that I've used, the balm was blue (new formula). It appears as though Ulta tried to clear out quickly expiring stock by placing it on sale.

reviews.headline: Works great!
reviews.comments: I don't wear makeup but have rosacea and find it a challenge to find a good facial cleanser that doesn't dry out my skin or irritate it and this is perfect.

reviews.headline: It burned my skin.
reviews.comments: I wanted to absolutely love this product so bad but it stunged my face horribly, it burned my skin barrier when i used it. ðŸ˜­ It worked on many other people's skin, but not mine. (I have sensitive skin/oily.)

reviews.headline: cleanses and doesn't irritate my skin
reviews.comments: melts away all my makeup. love it

reviews.headline: Huge fan of this cleansing balm
reviews.comments: I really love this cleansing balm. Just a pea size amount is enough to cut through all my makeup at the end of the day and it removes mascara very well. I follow it up with a micellar water to make sure no residue is left behind, then wash with Cetaphil and moisturize and my skin feels wonderful after. However my eyes will water badly at night if I don't take all the Banila cleanser off with a micellar water. Might just be a me issue as my eyes are sensitive to products.

reviews.headline: The best balm
reviews.comments: I love this product so much and recommend it to all my friends.

reviews.headline: Don't fix something that isn't brokeâ€¦..
reviews.comments: This is supposed to be the reformulated version of the purity cleansing balm, and now containes fragrance and olive oil. Both of which contribute to acne/irritation. It seems like many if not all brands have been reformulating their products and it is extremely frustrating.

reviews.headline: Love this balm!
reviews.comments: The Calming Cleansing Balm is a fantastic product that melts away waterproof makeup and impurities while being gentle on sensitive skin. Its balm-to-oil formula, featuring Cica-Relief, instantly soothes and protects, making your skin feel pampered. Packed with seven natural herbs like Centella and Green Tea Extract, it keeps your skin calm and balanced. Plus, the ZERO BALANCE TECHNOLOGY ensures a deep clean without stripping away your skin's natural moisture, leaving you with a fresh and healthy complexion.

reviews.headline: Pleasantly surprised
reviews.comments: this product was gifted to me by Banila. I was nervous when I first tried it, as I thought it might feel greasy or strange. The first time I used it I was so impressed as literally everything melted off so easily and my skin felt amazing! super soft!

reviews.headline: Easy Makeup Removal
reviews.comments:
I love using cleansing balms or oils to remove makeup as opposed to makeup wipes. This balm is easy to use and takes my makeup off within 30 secs. It was very gentle on the skin and didn't leave my skin feeling excessively dry afterwards. Would definitely recommend to makeup lovers. 
gifted by Banila Co

reviews.headline: Melts away makeup!
reviews.comments: I am super impressed and amazed by this cleansing balm! It completely melted away my makeup and waterproof mascara and it washes off with water not leaving any greasiness. Ive tried other ones that leave a greasy feeling but not this one this is the second one i try from this brand, ive tried a green one and both are amazing! I definitely recommend!

reviews.headline: A must have
reviews.comments:
Gifted by banila co.

The Clean it Zero Calming Cleansing Balm has become a staple in my skincare routine. It makes my skin feel brand new,super soft, smooth, and incredibly hydrated! This balm feels so luxurious on my face, melting like butter with each use.
Whether I'm wearing a full face of makeup or just sunscreen, this balm works wonders. It effectively removes waterproof makeup, leaving my skin clean and refreshed. What I love most is how it calms my skin, being gentle enough for even the most sensitive skin types.
The vegan balm-to-oil formulation instantly dissolves impurities and makeup buildup, while the Cica-Relief (Centella Asiatica) soothes and protects sensitive skin. It's perfect for anyone looking for a gentle yet effective cleanser that leaves your skin feeling soft, and hydrated.
 Clean it Zero Calming Cleansing Balm is a must-try.

reviews.headline: So nice for cleansing sensitive skin!
reviews.comments: I love how this is made for sensitive skin! I in fact had to use this once because I put a moisturizer on that had an ingredient I was allergic too and I ran to use this cleaning balm to help immediately cleanse and soothe my skin and it worked very well! It feels good on the skin and helps to keep it from drying out. It also took all my makeup and spf off and left my skin clean and moisturized!

reviews.headline: So nice for cleansing sensitive skin!
reviews.comments: I love how this is made for sensitive skin! I in fact had to use this once because I put a moisturizer on that had an ingredient I was allergic too and I ran to use this cleaning balm to help immediately cleanse and soothe my skin and it worked very well! It feels good on the skin and helps to keep it from drying out. It also took all my makeup and spf off and left my skin clean and moisturized!

media.headline: Sneaky reformulation
media.caption: Old is on the left, new on the right.

faceoff_positive.comments:
The Clean It Zero Calming Cleansing Balm by Banila Co has become a staple in my skincare routine, especially with my sensitive skin prone to rosacea and eczema. This balm stands out for its gentle yet effective formula, designed to soothe and cleanse without irritation.

The buttery texture melts into the skin, transforming into a silky oil that easily breaks down stubborn makeup and sunscreen. Infused with soothing ingredients like Centella Asiatica extract and licorice root, it calms redness and irritation, making it perfect for sensitive skin. Plus, it's free from harsh chemicals, ensuring a gentle cleanse without stripping natural oils.

After rinsing, my skin feels soft, clean, and hydrated, with no greasy residue. Over time, I've noticed a reduction in redness and sensitivity. The Clean It Zero Calming Cleansing Balm is an outstanding choice for anyone seeking a gentle yet effective cleanser.
faceoff_positive.headline: The Clean It Zero Calming Cleansing Balm by Banila Co

faceoff_negative.comments:
I loved and used the old Purifying balm for years, and I hadn't seen anything about a reformulation, but my last order ended up being the new version (which is now "Calming"). I didn't realize it because the packaging barely changed, but the new one smells like Vicks Vaporub and made my skin and eyes burn. When I went digging, I found one reddit thread mentioning it, and apparently they've added eucalyptus oil and changed up some of the other ingredients. The entire reason I, and many others from what I've read, used the Purifying version is because I have sensitive skin and don't use scented products if I can help it, so I'm not sure why they decided to go that route.

I don't know if the other versions have been reformulated (I believe at least some have), so check your ingredients/packaging. Really wish the company had been more straightforward about changing things up so I didn't waste money on something I can't use. If they bring back the old Purifying formula, it'd be a 5 star review.
faceoff_negative.headline: Sneaky reformulation

rollup.name: Clean It Zero Calming Cleansing Balm
